sense.name: a cognitive state of comprehension of something
sense.commentary: UNDERSTANDING[+state][+cognitive][+comprehension][+of_subject] Note: implies a specific subject or knowledge domain that is understood by an agent.
sense.examples: Her understanding of Russian is excellent. The students displayed little understanding of the material on their exams. Bob admitted his understanding of quantum mechanics was pretty shaky.

sense.name: the general capacity for rational thought
sense.commentary: UNDERSTANDING[+quality][+capability][+of_thought][+rational] Note: refers to a general capacity of an agent to carry out reasoning or rational thought - not mastery of a specific content of information (Sense 1)
sense.examples: Johnny is a child of sufficient intelligence and understanding to know better. Will computers ever develop true understanding and reasoning capabilities?

sense.name: an agreement between parties
sense.commentary: UNDERSTANDING[+state][+social][+agreement][+informal] Note: implies a reciprocal agreement between people about something
sense.examples: I thought we had an understanding about no smoking in the house. He was allowed to come only on the understanding that he would be on his best behavior. We reached the understanding that we would agree to disagree about it.

sense.name: a sympathetic inclination
sense.examples: We thanked them for their kindness and understanding during our family crisis. It's a delicate situation that needs to be handled with some patience and understanding. John blurted out the joke without any understanding for Mary's feelings.

sense.name: an interpretation or explanation
sense.commentary: UNDERSTANDING[+state][+cognitive][+belief][+interpretation] Note: refers to an agent's belief, conclusion, interpretation of events
sense.examples: My understanding was that he is planning to move out on the 30th. Was it your understanding that the president was opposed to this new policy?
